verses.text: And he shewed me Joshua the high priest standing before the angel of the \sc Lord\sc*, and Satan standing at his right hand to resist him.
And the \sc Lord\sc* said unto Satan, The \sc Lord\sc* rebuke thee, O Satan; Even the \sc Lord\sc* that hath chosen Jerusalem rebuke thee: \add Is\add* not this a brand pluckt out of the fire?
Now Joshua was clothed with filthy garments, and stood before the angel.

And he answered and spake unto those that stood before him, saying, Take away the filthy garments from him. And unto him he said, Behold, I have caused thine iniquity to pass from thee, and \add I will\add* clothe thee with change of raiment.
And I said, Let them set a fair mitre upon his head. So they set a fair mitre upon his head, and clothed him with garments. And the angel of the \sc Lord\sc* stood \add by\add*.
And the angel of the \sc Lord\sc* protested unto Joshua, saying,

Thus saith the \sc Lord\sc* of hosts; If thou wilt walk in my ways, and if thou wilt keep my charge, Then thou shalt also judge my house, and shalt also keep my courts, And I will give thee places to walk among these that stand \add by\add*.
Hear now, O Joshua the high priest, thou, And thy fellows that sit before thee: For they \add are\add* men wondered at: For behold, I \add will\add* bring forth my servant the BRANCH.

For behold the stone that I have laid before Joshua; Upon one stone \add shall be\add* seven eyes: Behold, I \add will\add* engrave the graving thereof, saith the \sc Lord\sc* of hosts, And I will remove the iniquity of that land in one day.
In that day, saith the \sc Lord\sc* of hosts, Shall ye call every man his neighbour, Under the vine and under the fig tree.
